intro: Tragopogon canus, commonly known as the yellow goosgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces a distinctive yellow flower that matures into a tuft of bristly seeds, aiding in wind pollination. Tragopogon canus typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas, showcasing its adaptability to various environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
